choices.A: Updating the playbooks with better decision points
choices.B: Dividing the network into trusted and untrusted zones

questions.question_text: The SOC is reviewing processes and procedures after a recent incident. The review indicates it took more than 30 minutes to determine that quarantining an infected host was the best course of action. This allowed the malware to spread to additional hosts before it was contained. Which of the following would be BEST to improve the incident response process?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Updating the playbooks with better decision points will help the SOC team to make quicker and more informed decisions during an incident. This will help to contain the incident and minimize the damage.

Selected Answer: A
A. Updating the playbooks with better decision points

Selected Answer: A
Only one makes sense

Selected Answer: A
MAC flooding:
MAC flooding is a network attack where an attacker floods a switch with a large number of Ethernet frames, each containing different source MAC addresses. The goal is to overwhelm the switch's MAC address table and force it into a "fail-open" mode, where it starts broadcasting traffic to all ports, effectively turning it into a hub. This allows the attacker to capture network traffic intended for other devices.

Selected Answer: D

questions.question_text: An organization just experienced a major cyberattack incident. The attack was well coordinated, sophisticated, and highly skilled. Which of the following targeted the organization?

questions.question_text: A smart switch has the ability to monitor electrical levels and shut off power to a building in the event of power surge or other fault situation. The switch was installed on a wired network in a hospital and is monitored by the facilities department via a cloud application. The security administrator isolated the switch on a separate VLAN and set up a patching routine. Which of the following steps should also be taken to harden the smart switch?

choices.A: Set up an air gap for the switch.
choices.B: Change the default password for the switch
choices.D: Install a cable lock on the switch.
choices.C: Place the switch in a Faraday cage.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Credit card = PCI DSS

Selected Answer: A
The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) is an information security standard used to handle credit cards from major card brands. So this is correct answer.

Selected Answer: A
A. PCI DSS (Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard).

PCI DSS is a set of security standards designed to ensure that companies that process, store, or transmit credit card information maintain a secure environment. Compliance with PCI DSS is mandatory for any organization that accepts credit card payments, including e-commerce platforms. By adhering to PCI DSS requirements, the company can help protect sensitive credit card data from theft, fraud, and unauthorized access, thereby ensuring the security of its e-commerce transactions.

questions.question_text: A company recently set up an e-commerce portal to sell its products online. The company wants to start accepting credit cards for payment, which requires compliance with a security standard. Which of the following standards must the company comply with before accepting credit cards on its e-commerce platform?
